subject: PEL: enable base infrastructure for SBE FFDC base PEL create
commitMessage:
PEL: enable base infrastructure for SBE FFDC base PEL create

This commits provides the base infrastructure for SBE FFDC based
on createPELWithFFDCFiles`D-Bus method on the
org.open_power.Logging.PEL.

More details related to usage of this interface is documented
as part of extensions/openpower-pels/README.md.

In the PEL create interface if the type is custom and subtype
is 0xCB, PEL class function invokes SBE FFDC function to process
SBE FFDC to extract Hardware procedure added user data section and
callouts. SBE FFDC class appends the callout json and create
user data file based FFDC information and continue the normal
PEL create function.

SCOPE of this commit:
 - Add base infrastructure and control build only for "phal" supported
   systems. "phal" feature is mandatory requirement for processing
   SBE FFDC.
 - Add SBE FFDC raw information in PEL user data section

To enable this feature use the below meson build options
  meson build -Dopenpower-pel-extension=enabled -Dphal=enabled

Tested:

"Error Details": {
        "Message":"chipop timeout reported during SBE communication",
        "SRC6": [
           "0x2",
           "[0:15] chip position, [16:23] command class,
            [24:31] command type"
        ]
    },

"User Data 2": {
    "Section Version":          "1",
    "Sub-section type":         "203",
    "Created by":               "0x3500",
    "Data": [
        "FF DC 00 12 00 00 A1 01  00 8E CE 72 00 00 FF FE  |  ...........r....",
        "00 00 00 04 00 00 00 00  00 00 00 04 00 00 00 00  |  ................",
        "00 00 00 00 00 00 00 01  00 00 00 00 00 00 00 02  |  ................",
        "00 00 00 04 00 00 00 00  00 00 00 00 00 00 00 04  |  ................",
        "00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00                           |  ........"
    ]
}

Signed-off-by: Jayanth Othayoth <ojayanth@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I2200b3ba9c0977be13e71f25e87f0b16cb50ec5b

Not working as expected. need fix

Are you going to be creating a new FFDC file that will get turned into a UserData section?  And also add data to the AdditionalData property that will also go into the UserData section?  If that's the case, then how about instead of dealing with AdditionalData at all, you just make another FFDC file with a JSON format, which will end up in a UserData section anyway

- will be good for new comer if we added abbreviation?
- Do we need to mention that sbe ffdc support will be based on phal build-time configure option ?
Added Note at the end of this section. about build support
yes , this extension READ me is mainly for Openpower.
seems like a stray `?  Or maybe my screen is dirty
is it only for SBE FFDC type? How is it guarantee that other Custom type can not use ? subtype list is documented anywhere?
READ me only documented this . Long term we should move all custom types in common place.
is it required here ? it included at LN 33 (in your patch) based on flag
you don't even need to create this if it isn't an SBE error.  Also, how about sbeFFDC?

As i mentioned in the line 76 comments, need to define this function scope to delete the locally created files only after file usage.

Changed to sbeFFDC,
Hmm, I don't think I understand what you mean here.  If this isn't an SBE error, how would there be any locally created files to even delete?

As part of the FFDC processing , creating two files, which includes callout and addition debug data . These two file details are store as part of this sbeffdc object. As part of this object destuctor addded logic to remove thos files. That is why recoped objectde defintion here.

since ffdcFiles is constant, force to declare local copy and update. 
other than that modified the code as per comment.

Followed the extension folder license header.
 
@Matt can you please comment.
I'm OK either way. That SPDC form was something introduced to openbmc after a lot of the phosphor-logging code was written.  IF you do keep this, can you change the year to 2021?
this really has to stop the rest of the processing?

yes , processor index is the mandatory requirement FAPI based infrastructure processing.
Directions used here is incase any failured occured during the data processing , stop processing and create error log with FFDC in hex format. Add journal log to incate there is failure. In the libekb processing function, additional data includes the fail info , if requitred.
these are needed in a future commit?  Otherwise can remove.

i will continue the conversation from the earlier patch set here...

if processReq was false, why would sbeFFDC have any temporary files to delete?

I got straightened out after a discussion.  sbeFFDC can't be destroyed until the end of the PEL constructor because it needs to keep around the FFDC Files to be used below.

I think using a unique_ptr<sbeFFDC> that is only crearted if processReq is true may alleviate my concern of always creating this object.

You need to use "sbeFFDCPtr" ? 
I think, your SbeFFDC destructor will be called after LN 79 but, I guess your expecting end of PEL constructor?

it looks like remove() will throw an exception if the file isn't there, which would then get caught below, while skipping any remaining files in this loop.  It's a pretty unlikely case, but maybe you could just use the non-throwing version of this function, which takes a std::error_code& as the second argument, or catch inside the loop, and then I wouldn't worry about it ;)
